112.title: Vaporeon

1123.content:
You sat on the beach shore, enjoying the breeze and the sound of waves crashing. The house you lived in sat on top of a hill, allowing you a nice environment to live in with your Pokemon. You layed down and closed your eyes thinking over your life up intill now.

When you were ten years old, you discovered a injured anthro Eevee near your house. The Pokemon had been orphaned by a forest fire and was alone. You helped him and after he was healed the both of you decided to become partners. Over the next ten years the both of you battled against other trainers and helped take down evil organizations bent on enslaving Pokemon. Just last year, your Eevee finally decided what evolution stone he wanted. And so, Eevee evolved into Vaporeon.

Evolving came with some notable changes. Vaporeon gained a more lean muscled body and grew from his 6'4 height to his 7'3 height. Additionally his feet grew larger, almost reaching from your hand to elbow. While you were amazed at his new look, you also got annoyed whenever he teased your 5'3 height.

You were brought out of your reminiscing when you heard footsteps crunching the sand and getting closer to you. Opening your eyes you saw Vaporeon looming over, hands on his hips and slyly grinning. The water Pokemon was dressed in white silk pants and was topless, showing his muscled torso. He oddly had on a pair of dark blue sandals.

"Lost in ya thoughts partner", Vaporeon asked in his deep voice.

You sat up and looked over your shoulder, smiling at him. "I was just thinking about the past."

Vaporeon gained a sincere smile. He then sat down behind you, before pulling your body into his lap. His large and smooth blue arms snaked around you and pressed your body against his strong chest. You listened to his loud heartbeat and looked forward at his large sandaled feet easily dwarfing your own. You felt safe in Vaporeon's hold, his muscled embraced always put you at ease.

"I'm really glad I met you."

Huh?", looking up you saw Vaporeon looking out at the water smiling.

"You've always been there to help me. I feel happy when we win, not just because of the victory but also since you smile and the hug you give me."

You felt the arms tighten around you and the heartbeat seem to quicken.

"I couldn't imagine anyone else being my partner. The way you look up at me, let me carry you into the water, and even how you rub my feet sometimes. That's why....i care about you so much."

Vaporeon began to show signs of nervousness. From his arms tightening to his toes beginning to wiggle. You caught onto what he was saying and......you felt the same.

Looking up you.............

Taking a deep breath, you turned to the three. "Okay guys, once we go in we'll try to explain everything calmly ok?"

The three nodded before following you through the door. You immediately found the lobby seemingly empty with no one in sight.

"That's strange, I can sense something.", Lucas said as his eyes flashed blue. "The presence is......different, it's similar to us but also at the same time not."

"Huh, what's that supposed to mean?", Blaze said scratching his head.

Just as you were about to ask, a familiar cry rang out and made your heart stop.

"PIKA!"

Lucas smiled as his eyes flashed again. "He says thank you."

"Lucas you can understand him?", you asked curiously, getting a nod in return. An idea struck you.

"Hey Pikachu, can you tell us what happened after I vanished?"

Pikachu eagerly nodded, he began to quickly speak and move his paws as if gesturing to everything.

"Hm, he says after you vanished a massive power outage hit every building in town.", Lucas explained.

You widened your eyes. Did the crystal cause the loss of power? You nodded at Pikachu to continue.

"And so... after you disappeared I decided to help give some temporary power. The others were stuck in their pokeballs so I haven't been able to get them out."

Bending down, you rubbed Pikachu's head. "Great job in helping everyone buddy.", a cute chu~ was your reply. "But can you show me the others so I can see them please."

Pikachu quickly bounced up and ran over to a cart at the end of the room. You and the three anthros walked over to the cart holding two pokeballs. One had a fire sticker while the other had a blue flame.

"Sooo your team is in those balls?", Zapp said curiosity in his eyes.

You nodded, grabbing both of the pokeballs and turning to the open lobby. Taking a breath you pressed the buttons and threw the balls in the air as they opened and released two white rays of energy. As the light cleared you found yourself knocked to the floor by a heavy and furry weight.

"Ark!"

"Hey Arcanine."

Looking over, you saw a blue jackal like pokemon standing. He had a serious gaze as he approached you. Standing up, you were a little shorter as Lucario stood in front of you. "It's ok guys, these three helped me out. Their world is just....different from ours."

Zapp, Lucas, and Blaze smiled as they formally introduced themselves. Your pokemon were just as enthusiastic.

Now that you were reunited with your team, what was your next plan of action?

You’re walking through a snowy mountain trail, everything was a blur as the harsh winds pounded. You shivered as you walked, keeping one hand in front of your face trying to shield it from the storm. After a while you collapse in the snow, your body shivering.

“Hey, you ok? Whoa! Don’t pass out!” You hear a voice say as you begin to fade from consciousness. After a moment you pass out in the cold.

Hours later you begin to you wake. “Thank goodness you’re awake.” You look around and see that your laying on the palm of a giant. Your eyes slowly look up, your jaw drops when you realize your on the palm of a giant Mewtwo. He must be sixty feet in height, unlike most Mewtwo, he has golden eyes instead of purple. He also has golden-blonde fur covering his head with an unusual black lightning bolt pattern in it. “Hey, um... you ok?” He asks as he holds you close keeping you warm.

You can’t believe your eyes. You blink a few times still taking everything in. You see concern lining the Mewtwo’s face. “Don’t worry, buddy, I won’t hurt ya.” He says before gently stroking your head with his free hand.

You open your mouth to speak but have issues speaking. “Uh... I...”

“Don’t worry, you don’t have to speak. Just rest, I’ll keep ya safe.” Mewtwo says as he sits back in the vast cave where both of you are seeking refuge. He holds you against his chest, keeping you warm.

14313.content:
Ever since you were young, you'd had a deep love and appreciation for the oceans and seas, mostly any body of salt water in the world. Your parents had taken notice, and whenever they moved, they tried their hardest to make sure the new house was close enough for you to go enjoy the ocean. Today had been a rather slow day, not much had happened, and you were sitting on the sandy beach in front of your house, staring out into the glistening waves lit brilliantly by the sun's light. You closed your eyes and laid back, basking in the sun's warmth. Sadly, your soaking of the sun's rays was abruptly interrupted by a sudden appearance of a thick overcast. A small wind picked up, and the waves began to beat more intensely against the shore. Knowing full well how dangerous a rough wave was, you stood up and started to head back in to your home when you heard something burst forth out of the waves, uttering a loud, regal cry. Along with the darkened skies, you heard the rumble of thunder in the distance, and felt rain start to fall. Rain, wind, darkened skies, something coming out of the ocean. Your heart skipped a beat, it couldn't be! With lightning speed, you swiveled in the sand and turned to face the ocean once more, only to lock eyes with the legendary Pokemon Kyogre itself!

What do you do now?
14313.title: King of the Sea

You opened your eyes as the sound of the Doduo's cries rang out with the arrival of morning. Around your body was a warm weight wrapped like a pair of arms. Turning your head, the source of warmth was spotted.

It was your Charizard Kaen , wrapping his strong arms around you and holding your body to his chest with his chin resting on your head. Kaen wasn't like other Pokemon, he was part of a rare type called anthro Pokemon. His body was more human like and he had a more muscular physique, complete with toned arms, pecs, and a six pack.

At ten years old you started your Pokemon journey. However, rather then choosing a starter you went on the journey with Kaen a Charmander, after you helped him escape a forest fire. The next ten years were full of you and him traveling and getting stronger through battles and thwarting the evil plans of Pokemon crime syndicates. Now at the age of twenty, you've decided to take a break and try a hand in running a farm just to live a peaceful life.

Just as you started to get up, the strong arms of Kaen pulled you back as he let out a tired grunt. You sighed at the action.

"Kaen, I gotta get up. There's work to do."

The Charizard grunted and pulled you into his warm chest, making you blush at his warm skin. "Well you....*yawn* can do it later."

You giggled, before turning and looking up to see Kaen tiredly smiling down at you. "I wish, but I gotta make sure all the berries are well watered."

Kaen sighed and sat up, pulling you with him. "Well then I'll make us some breakfast." He said climbing out of the bed and walking out of your shared bedroom. Wearing only a pair of grey sweatpants.

You found your eyes on his back, toned with muscle. The back of his sweatpants was down slightly down due to his tail and let the top of his large firm orange butt hang out. You could hear his large three toed clawed feet slapping the floor.

Stretching your limbs, you decided to get ready. Climbing out of bed you put on a pair of cargo short and a red T-shirt. You would put on your gloves after breakfast.

As you walked into the kitchen you saw....
152321.title: You and Charizard

choices: Let's have some fun little buddy
1523213.content:
To your surprise Kaen wasn't in the kitchen. You frown wondering where he could have gone. Then you hear his voice outside calling you. You still want breakfast, so you grab some bread make a quick sandwich and head outside. Your farm is pretty spacious and more that little isolated. It was pretty far out there nothing but plains to the north for days. The only company you got was the monthly delivery truck, that would come and take your products back to the city. But you liked the quiet so this wasn't really a problem.

Anyway, you see where Kean is and make your way over to him. He's standing before a strange looking berry bush. You'd never seen this type before. It looked like a rainbow had wrapped itself around the berry and it was shaped like a diamond. Kaen has one in his hands and is looking it over sniffing it. His eyes seemed to be locked on to the fruit, to the point where he can't hear you call out his name until you give him a light push. He snaps out of it looking at you still kind of in daze. "What", he says still a little groggy.

"Is this what you called me out here for", you ask pointing to the berries.

"Huh", he still seems a little out of it. "Oh yeah", he says. "I think it might be some kind of mutation. I've never seen this kind though. Wonder what it taste like?"

He stares at the berry again his eyes glossing over like he's being hypnotized. Before you can say anything he pops the berry into his mouth. His eyes light up as he chews, then without any warning Kaen turns towords the bush and begins rapidly picking and devouring the berries as if possessed by some sort of force. You try to get him to stop but he's much stronger then you so he doesn't even notice you. Not wanting to lose your hands by trying to nab the berries away from his sharp teeth, you unfortunately wait until he's finished. After the last berry has been eaten he seems to be back to his regular self.

"Kaen", what in Arceus's name were you thinking", you snap at him. "We've never seen this type of berry before it could be poisonous."

"Sorry buddy I", you cut him off.

"Don't sorry buddy me", you shout. "What was with you, you devoured them like you were in a trance."

"They were just so good I couldn't...", Kaen trailed off.

"You couldn't what? Stop! Is that it Kaen you couldn't stop. What kind of excuse is...", now it's your turn to trail off. You look at your Charizard and see him looking crestfallen and hurt. Sighing you address him. "Look Kaen, I'm sorry I yelled. I was just worried about you. We don't know anything about those berries, and now we may never." You look at the bush no completely devoid and slowly withering away. "You pat his snout. "But you don't look hurt now come on we need to...", you trail off and stare baffled and somewhat scared at Kaen.

The pokemon has stared glowing with all the colors of the rainbow. You back away slightly and Kaen notices and looks down at himself. "What the what's going...ow!" Kaen suddenly grabs his head and gets on his knees before moving one of his hands to his chest. You watch as your Charizard starts breathing heavily and the glow around him intensifies. It's blinding you at this point, but you rush up and hug Kaen telling him that your here. You feel Kaen wrap his arms around you and falls flat on his back. Light engulfs you both as you pass out.

For a while all you see is darkness but then you hear a voice. Kaen's voice. It's loud and muffled at first and you can pick out tidbits at first.

Crap... Cra... ap... ho... id ... s... pen"

You focus a bit more.

"Com... on... ake... up. I... eed... ou."

Suddenly your eyes snap open and you sit bolt up right. You look around. Your sitting in the middle of the farm, it's a little dark how long have you been out. Wait, where's Kaen. Suddenly a loud voice booms out above you.

"Oh thank Arceus, your awake."

You slowly trail your eyes upwards and take in the view of a one hundred foot tall charizard leaning down over you looking worried. You try to move your mouth but it doesn't seem to work. You sit there in shock as it talks down at you.

"I was really worried, you know. You were out for hours Anyway I think those berries did this. But I'm so glad your awake now, you've only been out for a few hours but am I ever glad that your awake." You sit there mouth agape. "I finished all the work today. Being a hundred feet tall kind of makes farm work a breeze. But I could really use your help right now." You just stare up in awe. " "Uh buddy, you okay. It's me it's Kaen."

Your brain slowly starts to process what happens and you struggle to your feet and slip and nearly fall flat on your face. But Kaen reaches down and gently uses one of his fingers to break your fall. "Careful", you hear his voice boom out above you. Grapping the digit you slowly push your self upwards and look up into your Charizard's eyes. They stare back in concern. After managing to right yourself. You watch as Kaen looks down at you, a little worried.

"Kaen", you start. "Is that really you?"

'Yeah" he replies.

"Your... your huge."

"Yeah I noticed."

"But ho- those berries."

"Yup" is all he can say."

"They did this to you, we need to figure out how to fix this. I need to do some research." You start heading off towards your house, when Kaen sit's down with a large thud. The impact knocking you off your feet and your Charizard once again reaching down to stop your fall. Kaen has now one hundred percent blocked off your route to the house. You start to try and climb over Kaen but he merely picks you up around your waist and put's you in his palm.

"Wow, woe, buddy. Who says we need to fix this." He asks you.

You stare dumbfounded up at him. "Kaen look at you your huge."

"Yeah but why do we need to fix this. I think this is a good thing."

"How it this a good thing", you ask shocked.

"Well for starters, didn't you hear me when I said I did an entire day's work in an hour. Think about it, buddy. I did a whole day's work in an hour. Do you have any idea how much time that frees up? It's more time for us to relax." You can't believe what your hearing. "plus as you've said I'm huge. Stray Pokemon aren't going to come anywhere near me, when i'm this big. So no more of our berries getting eaten. And I can scare off any wild Pokemon that get to close to our Miltank."

"But what'll you eat", you asks back.

"Berries", Kaen replies. They don't take that long to grow and we have plenty of land all we need to do is expand. Plus I can just get water from the nearby rivers and lake. and because were so isolated no one's going to see me and if they do what can they do about it?" Kaen smiles. You find it very hard to argue with his logic.

"But what are you going to wear. You can't just wear those sweatpants everyday." While your thankful that Kaen's pants grew with him, you knew this wasn't a compelling argument.

"So I'll just wash them and go o natural for a while." you suddenly turn bright red just picturing that. Your Charizard sees and smiles slyly. "Not that you'd have any problem with that, what with how often you look at me." You go even redder, and try to retort but Kaen nearly picks you up and places you on his warm chest. "Besides, I think you like seeing me this big, I certainly like you being this small. He gently pushes you between his six pacts and you pray to god he doesn't notice that your arousal. You catch his eyes, and know that he does. You sigh in defeat. "Now then", he says

To call my love for Pokémon more than normal is an understatement. Obsession is probably the right word. I didn’t own any, I never had the money to spare for pokeballs, but I’d always foster a wild one, and I’d saved many Pokémon’s lives before. I’m not trying to say I’m better than the Pokémon center, but it takes time to get there and I don’t always get that much time. Most of them never stay more than a day, only to drink a little water, have some food, or maybe warm up if it’s winter, and I’ve seen nearly 500 Pokémon in my lifetime, but the ones I’m most entranced by are always the ones I don’t get to see. Obviously legendaries aren’t really ever gonna need my help, but there were a lot of Pokémon I surprisingly never got to see. Fire types were common, whether due to winter or rain, but one of the only ones I’d never seen was litten. And of course a litten was the Pokémon I wanted most. We had one when I was a kid, but it never evolved and died when I was about 5 due to... well, I don’t even remember why, but it was too complicated for my little kid brain. So imagine my surprise, when, on a perfectly warm summer day, one literally just walks up to me. It was hurt, but it’s body seemed to be OK. One of the main things that makes pokemon healing so hard is the fact that they can have both physical injuries and type-specific injuries, which is why most pets are a normal or flying type, they don’t require much work to take care of. All color was gone from the litten’s eyes, and it struggled to stand. It was skinny to the point it looked like it had a vacuum suck any space between its skin and bone from it. I had a few potions and berries, but that wasn’t enough for this. The skinniness wasn’t even natural, it’s hard to explain, but it just looked artificial. I brought it inside, grabbed one of just 3 full restored I owned for emergencies, and sprayed it all over the litten. When I rolled it onto it’s back, I saw a literal hole in its stomach, which probably explained the whole vacuum thing, but was still a problem. I had seen these types of holes before, but only on dead Pokémon. This had managed to escape, if barely, but still. Whatever attacked it had sucked the life energy out of it, and judging by its looks, there was none left. It’s existence was solely because of its will to live. It was a lot stronger than I was giving it credit for, then. All I could really do was keep it warm and try to start a fire. To get the life energy back for a pokemon, you can never fully restore it, but there are some ways. For a fire type, that would be with a fire, and luckily I happen to have a fireplace. I got a fire started, put the litten next to it, it’s a him, I think, and watched as the flame was funneled through that hole back into its body. This is when I could tell he was special, and why he was drained in the first place. Most Pokémon would’ve only had a pretty small amount restored, but he got way more than a normal Pokémon would’ve. Immediately, color came back to his eyes, and that vacuum sealed look was gone. He had even gotten a decent bit bigger, but was still pretty small when you remember he’s a litten. Just a little over 2 feet tall, and the hole he’d been drained from was healed over. He jumped into my lap and purred as he promptly fell asleep in my arms. That’s when I noticed a team rocket R on his stomach, right where that hole had been. As soon as I touched it, he woke up and visibly shivered. We didn’t see any other grunts, or even any other Pokémon for an unnervingly long amount of time. We then found 15, all standing in front of a suspiciously armored door.”You think you can take them?” I asked. “Honestly? No.” There was a sadness there, he’d never not been able to take a challenge yet. We turned around, only to find our way out blocked off by tons of wreckage. He slowly started lifting at the rubble, and though it took some time, he was getting through it. He threw the last piece away only to be met face to face with a rocket elite. Or, face to chest for the rocket member, who’s cocky smirk melted into fear as Incineroar picked him up, knocked him out, and released all his Pokémon, who sacrificed their life energy to him. “I can hear them, speaking to me. Telling me things like where some hidden passages are, where grunts hide, and even a life energy stockpile.” The energy the Pokémon had given him had started to kick in, and this growth spurt left him at 11 feet tall exactly, and somehow fit even more muscle onto his already massive frame. “Now I think we can take those guys.” He dropped down from the hole, his shoulders almost getting caught, and easily taking them all down. 15 grunts with a few Pokémon each meant this was his biggest spurt yet. He was over 15 feet tall, and at least half that wide. With that obstacle down, a new one was created. The doorway. He was just too big to get through. So he just made a bigger door. He could literally walk through the steel unfazed. Entering the room, we were met with...
15533222212221.title: Straight into rocket’s base

choices: Continuation of the story with Incineroar
155332222122211.content:
We walked in to find 10 team rocket elites, each with Pokémon as big as Incineroar, all staring at us. “I’m impressed you got this far, looks like I raised you both well.” That was my dad. Of course it was.

Finding out your parents are crime bosses isn’t exactly something good to hear, especially when you just found out they almost killed your childhood pet.

“Oh, I’m gonna kill you both.” Incineroar said, with shaking anger in his deep, powerful voice.

The rocket Pokémon may be stronger than him, but Incineroar has the advantage of his mind with him, the other Pokémon were just big brick walls. In the time Incineroar had already knocked 3 of them out, the other 7 Pokémon had only just started moving. Once they did move bough, there was the problem of the 1v7 currently happening. He was barely dodging them, and he looked to me with panic in his eyes. What could I do? I couldn’t look away...

But neither could the rocket members.

While they were distracted by the titans, I was able to call their Pokémon back, all except for one, giving the fair fight he deserved. It took the elites time to realize what I did, but Incineroar easily won the one on one, and received the biggest flow of life energy yet. Most of these Pokémon were already stuffed full of the energy due to how many Pokémon rocket drained, and it showed here. He was now 25 feet tall, and was packing even more tons of muscle on top of what was already there. It was around this time the rocket elites realized what I did and released the 6 remaining Pokémon. However, those other 3 from the start? Incineroar was being fed their energy as the remaining 6 came out. He was easily 50 feet tall now, and had at least doubled his musculature once more. Any sign of a neck he had was swallowed by his traps, and he still moved with impossible agility. The 6 remaining Pokémon were no match. They were all drained back to what they should’ve had anyway, and were picked up and released from their captivity by a 100 foot tall Incineroar back into the wild.

Both my parents lunged at me, but not before Incineroar swept me up. “The police are coming. One movement from any of you and you’re all dead. One noise from any of you and you’re all dead.”

They complied, and Incineroar somehow managed to hide himself while the rocket members were arrested. “How did you get them to be like this?” An officer asked. “Ah, I’ve got some pretty strong pokemon. Had them since I was a kid, actually.” She seemed to wave it off, probably just happy to not have to go on a wild goose chase every other day.

Once they were all gone, me and Incineroar were left at the ruins of their base and the area around it. I watched him nick a hole in his stomach where that original hole had been when I first found him, and watched as tons of life energy spilled out of him. He was still way bigger than normal, 8 feet tall on the dot, but all the plants were restored, and then some. What had been the team rocket headquarters had turned into a beautiful place for Pokémon in an ever shrinking wilderness. It reached far, too. Hundreds of areas around the country received this treatment, making nearly 1000 new square miles of forests and general areas for wild Pokémon. And with team rocket gone, everyone could breathe easy and enjoy what the world had to offer for a while.
155332222122211.title: A team rocket elite board meeting

info.brief_description: Pocket Monsters? Yeah, right. macro goodness inside!
info.description:
This interactive is obviously about giant pokemon. Essentially, you're not only in a world where pokemon and anthro pokemon exist, you're also in a world where pokemon and anthro pokemon will somehow change size for whatever reason you can think of (But you can't shrink, it's not allowed). However, before we get started on this enormous escapade, I'd just like to lay down some rules:

All Pokémon are all males (Pokemon that are female are not allowed I'm sorry)

They can become anthro Pokémon if they want to but make sure they are friendly.

You can allow specific Mega Pokémon like Mega Lucarios, Mega Lopunny and Mega Manectric.
.
You can choose which pokemon you like eg: luxray Buizel, Floatzel, Vulpix, Eevee and their 7 Eeveelutions, Electrike, Manectric, Shinx Luxio yellow umbreon riolu and lucario.

If you start with that character do not forget to put a chapter of that is unique like a 7'3 foot tall gold eyed lucario and a 8'9 foot tall red eyed muscle floatzel that wants more muscle and size while being friendly.

- The story is observed primarily by the main character, who is to remain nondescript and human (EDIT: I originaly had gender-neutral, as well, but there's some situations where it makes more sense for the character to have a gender). This allows the reader to use their imagination and insert whoever they want into the role of the protagonist. You can change POV if you want, but leave a choice to continue as the main if you do.

- No killing the main.

- no sex and gay stuff. I'm really sorry

- No vore, but nonliving things can be eaten (Exception: Living fish can be eaten if it makes sense in context. IE: Lugia passed by a school of fish and gobbled them all up. Just don't overplay it or anything).

- The pokemon can be as kind as you wish (They can't become evil or be evil at the start I'm sorry but thems the breaks), just remember the previous rules.

That about sums it up (Note how I've made no rules on sexual content. Take that as you will.). Have fun.
